definition: to reward or comfort with presents of food, drink etc
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: Louvre rewards your taste in food.
sentences.chinese: 羅浮宮隨時犒賞您的味蕾。

sentences.english: Eventually the examiner comes to her senses, and Alex gets the reward he deserves.
sentences.chinese: 最終測試者回過神兒來，給亞歷克斯以應得的犒賞。

sentences.english: Reward yourself with a treat when you reach your goals and set another one.
sentences.chinese: 達到目標後犒賞下自己，接着再製訂下一個。

sentences.english: Jenny and her boyfriend treated themselves to a nice dinner.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮和她男友犒賞自己，去吃了一頓大餐。

sentences.english: Reward your successes. As soon as you achieve something reward yourself.
sentences.chinese: 學會獎賞自己，一旦獲得成功就要犒賞一下自己。

sentences.english: You can enjoy the moment alone, and give yourself a present.
sentences.chinese: 你可以享受你的單身時光，並且藉此犒賞自己一下。

sentences.english: Luck is a gift gives by God to him who made a sincere effort.
sentences.chinese: 運氣是上帝犒賞艱苦努力的人的最好禮物。

sentences.english: So many people entered and I really wish I could reward everybody.
sentences.chinese: 參賽者紛至沓來，我真心希望能夠犒賞每一個參與者。

sentences.english: Rewards will increase your motivation to accomplish your goals.
sentences.chinese: 這犒賞會刺激你去完成剩下的任務。

sentences.english: When you get an assignment or test deadline, right then and there, decide on a reward for completing it successfully.
sentences.chinese: 當你成功完成一項任務或測驗順利時就犒賞一下自己。

sentences.english: Their rewards were jobs for life and pay rising with age.
sentences.chinese: 對這些員工的犒賞，就是終生職業和薪隨齡漲的機制。

definition: to show appreciation (by kind words, small gifts etc)/to comfort
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
guests feel at home (in a hotel, guest house etc)/a home away from home
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to surrender and pay allegiance to
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
